item.title: Conference opens up pathway for Ukraine's war victims to claim compensation
item.description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba addressed the Restoring Justice for Ukraine conference in the Hague on Tuesday, telling delegates the people of Ukraine ''want to see justice delivered''.

item.title: WATCH: Musical medic students perform at Gold Coast hospital
item.description: The corridors of a Gold Coast hospital are filled with beautiful sounds, offering a much-welcomed respite for some patients.

item.title: In Bucha, moving on remains struggle two years after liberation
item.description: Many Ukraninans in Bucha are struggling to come to terms with what happened to them and their loved ones.

item.title: Russia planning major new offensive in Donetsk region in coming months, ISW says
item.description: A recent battalion-sized action that was repelled by Ukrainian forces gives an indication of Russia's new priorities.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 2nd – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Eight dead after car carrying suspected migrants crashes in Albania
item.description: Albania is a route for some migrants heading for the EU, which is working with the country to close off paths into the bloc.

item.title: Channel opened for vessels clearing collapsed Baltimore bridge site
item.description: The owner and manager of the container ship that crashed into a supporting column one week ago are taking legal action to limit liability.

item.title: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 29 people
item.description: An investigation into the fire has been launched, and arrest warrants have been issued for 5 suspects.

item.title: Gang and police gunbattles paralyse area near Haiti's National Palace
item.description: At least one policeman was shot after he and other officers were forced to flee an armoured car that was later set on fire, according to local media reports.

item.title: Aid group in Gaza claims Israeli airstrike killed at least six workers
item.description: The workers were allegedly in the process of delivering aid to Gaza's population when they were struck.

item.title: WATCH: Ultra-Orthodox Jews protest against new military draft exemption rules
item.description: Police use water cannons to disperse the protesters blocking a road in central Israel.

item.title: Ukraine apparently mounts deepest drone strike inside Russia to date
item.description: With badly needed battlefield weapons and ammunition supplies dwindling, Ukraine is hitting Russia from the air.

item.title: Norway follows Denmark with plans to conscript thousands more soldiers
item.description: Russia's attack on Ukraine has given northern European countries an impetus to beef up their militaries.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Finland: Child dead and two wounded at school shooting near Helsinki
item.description: The shooting took place at the Viertola school in Vantaa, a suburb of the Finnish capital, where around 800 students and 90 staff attend.

item.title: Israel expresses 'sorrow' for deadly airstrike on foreign aid workers in Gaza
item.description: Israeli airstrikes killed humanitarians delivering food into the West Bank, according to verified footage.

item.title: Hungarian village celebrates Easter with centuries old tradition
item.description: The northern Hungarian village of Holloko celebrates Easter Monday in its own particular - and peculiar - way.

item.title: Russian security agency says suspects detained in Dagestan linked to Moscow attack
item.description: The detained are suspected of channelling funds and providing weapons to the gunmen who attacked the concert hall in Moscow.

item.title: Eight dead as bus collides with train in Russia
item.description: The Russian Emergency Ministry said all eight passengers on the bus were killed in the village of Berendeyevo in the Yaroslavl region.

item.title: Israeli forces end raid on Gaza's main hospital, aid ships arrive off the coast
item.description: All the latest developments from the Israel- Hamas war.

item.title: Hot temperatures send Cypriots to the beach on National Day
item.description: Temperatures exceeded 30 degrees Celsius on 1 April sending Cypriots to the beach on Cyprus National Day.

item.title: Iran vows revenge after strike it blames on Israel demolished consulate in Syria
item.description: The Iranian military adviser Mohammad Reza Zahedi killed in the air strike led the elite Quds Force in Lebanon and Syria until 2016.

item.title: First Romania-Bulgaria flight takes place after partial Schengen entry
item.description: The first Schengen zone flight between Romania and Bulgaria took place the day after the countries partially joined Europe’s ID-check-free travel zone.

item.title: Large fire breaks out at production facility in Russia's Yekaterinburg
item.description: The fire broke out on the roof of the workshop producing electricity transformers.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: 'Havana syndrome' possibly linked to Russian intelligence, media report finds
item.description: A new joint investigation by The Insider, Der Spiegel and CBS’s 60 Minutes suggests the mysterious syndrome, which has affected several US diplomats in recent years, is linked to a Russian intelligence unit.

item.title: All eyes on Sinner as he takes home another victory at the Masters
item.description: Jannik Sinner's stellar performance in 2024 continued as he clinched the Miami Open title with a 6-3, 6-1 victory over 11th seed Grigor Dimitrov on Sunday.

item.title: France and China discuss trade and Ukraine ahead of Xi Jinping visit
item.description: The meeting between the French foreign minister and his Chinese counterpart comes ahead of a Chinese leader Xi Jinping's planned visit to France.

item.title: Bucha remembers fallen servicemen in city's second liberation anniversary
item.description: Mourners gathered with flowers at the city's cemetery to pay their respects. At least 270 people were buried there.

item.title: WATCH: Inside Berlin's Disgusting Food Museum
item.description: Snake wine, snails or bull’s penis might not be something for you, but others find them delicious.

item.title: Authorities find remains of missing French toddler Emile Soleil
item.description: Remains of Emile who went missing from the small French alpine village of Le Vernet last July were found over the weekend.

item.title: Moscow continues to target Ukraine's civilian infrastructure
item.description: Russian strikes left hundreds of thousands without power in the region of Odesa on Easter Sunday.

item.title: Rare 'marching Judas' procession kicks off in Czechia

item.title: Turkey's opposition make huge gains in local elections
item.description: Erdogan acknowledged the electoral setback in a speech, saying his party had suffered “a loss of altitude” across Turkey.

item.title: Israel sees largest anti-government protest since Hamas war began
item.description: Nearly six months of conflict have renewed divisions over the leadership of hard-line Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Thrilling finale in Antalya
item.description: The air was electric and fans were kept on the edge of their seats as the Antalya Grand Slam came to a close

item.title: Turkish opposition leads in vote to run Istanbul and other key cities, preliminary results show
item.description: The CHP's lead in Turkey's largest metropole would be a major upset to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who had set his sights on retaking control in Istanbul and other major urban areas.

item.title: Pope Francis calls for a ceasefire in Gaza during a blustery Easter Sunday Mass
item.description: Despite health concerns, the pontiff led the service in front of tens of thousands of people who had gathered in St Peter's Square in Vatican City.

item.description: Pope Francis presides over the Vatican's Easter Vigil, as Germany's Easter peace marches call for end of war in Ukraine and Gaza.

item.description: All the latest developments from the Israel- Hamas war.

item.title: Romania and Bulgaria partly join Schengen area after thirteen-year-long wait
item.description: A veto from Austria means the new status will not apply for land routes, due to concerns of an influx of refugees.

item.title: The race is on for key cities as Turkey holds local elections
item.description: The vote is a barometer of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s popularity as he seeks to win back control of key urban areas he lost to the opposition five years ago

item.title: Does the European Union have the resources to match its ambitions?
item.description: Calls to reform the institutions to make the EU more efficient, more democratic and better adapted to contemporary challenges are growing.
